texas(GPE) - sen - cornyn - announces - run - for - gop(ORG) - leader - as - scramble - to - succeed - mcconnell - begins - in - the - senate : 

washington(GPE) — texas(GPE) sen . john(PERSON) cornyn(PERSON) has informed his colleagues that he intends to run for senate(ORG) republican(NORP) leader , becoming the first(ORDINAL) senator to announce a campaign after sen . mitch(PERSON) mcconnell(PERSON) said he will step down from the post in november(DATE) . 

cornyn(PERSON) , who served as mcconnell(PERSON) ’s no . 2(CARDINAL) in leadership before he was term - limited out of the job five(DATE) years(DATE) ago(DATE) , is citing his experience in that role in a statement thursday(DATE) to fellow senators announcing his run . but he also is trying to distinguish himself from mcconnell(PERSON) , saying , “ i believe the senate(ORG) is broken — that is not news to anyone . ” 

“ from experience , i have learned what works in the senate(ORG) and what does not , ” cornyn(PERSON) said . “ and i am confident senate(ORG) republicans(NORP) can restore our institution to the essential role it serves in our constitutional republic . ” 

there has long been speculation that cornyn(GPE) , south(GPE) dakota(GPE) sen(GPE) . john(PERSON) thune(PERSON) and wyoming(PERSON) sen(PERSON) . john(PERSON) barrasso(PERSON) — the “ three(CARDINAL) johns ” — would vie to replace mcconnell(PERSON) , r(ORG) -(ORG) ky(ORG) .(ORG) , if and when mcconnell(PERSON) were to step down . but the longtime leader ’s surprise announcement on wednesday(DATE) that he wo n’t run again for republican(NORP) leader after the november(DATE) elections has jump - started the campaign earlier than expected , almost(DATE) nine(DATE) months(DATE) before gop(ORG) senators are expected to gather and choose a new leader behind closed doors . 

cornyn(ORG) , a former texas(GPE) attorney general who was first(ORDINAL) elected to the senate(ORG) in 2002(DATE) , is a prominent member of the(ORG) senate(ORG) judiciary(ORG) committee(ORG) and a popular member of the gop(ORG) conference who is seen as a steady hand . he has managed to bridge some of the caucus ’ deep divides in recent(DATE) years(DATE) while also occasionally negotiating with democrats(NORP) , as he did on bipartisan gun legislation in 2022(DATE) . 

he is also a prolific fundraiser for the party , having raised a total of $(MONEY) 13(MONEY) million(MONEY) for incumbents , the party ’s senate(ORG) campaign arm , and senate(ORG) republican(NORP) nominees already in the 2024(DATE) cycle . 

in his statement , cornyn(PERSON) said he believes he has “ built a track record of listening to colleagues and seeking consensus , while leading the fight to stop bad policies that are harmful to our nation and the conservative cause . ” 

cornyn(PERSON) said he would work to improve communication , try to move spending bills individually and make an effort to include every member in decisions . that ’s a response to frequent complaints from some senators about massive year(DATE) -(DATE) end(DATE) spending bills and mcconnell(PERSON) ’s top - down leadership approach . 

both thune(GPE) , the current no . 2(CARDINAL) republican(NORP) , and barrasso(GPE) , the chairman of the senate(ORG) gop(ORG) conference , have left the door open to runs after mcconnell(PERSON) ’s announcement . neither has officially announced a campaign for the job . 

thune(PERSON) told reporters that mcconnell(PERSON) ’s departure leaves “ big shoes to fill , ” but that now is a time “ to reflect on his service and and honor him for that . and then we ’ll we ’ll go from there . ” after cornyn(PERSON) ’s announcement , a spokesman for thune(ORG) said the senator is reaching out to colleagues to discuss “ the future of the senate(ORG) republican(NORP) conference and what they would like to see in their next leader , ” but intends on keeping those conversations private . 

barrasso(PERSON) said wednesday(DATE) he ’s focused on the november(DATE) election and getting a senate(ORG) majority . in terms of leadership decisions , “ i ’m going to talk to members of the conference , hear what they have to say , listen to them in terms of what direction they want to take . ” 

much of the race for leader is likely to take place through phone calls , one(CARDINAL) - on - one(CARDINAL) meetings and private gatherings over the(DATE) next(DATE) several(DATE) months(DATE) . unlike the house , where both parties vote for speaker in a public — and recently messy — spectacle , senate(ORG) party(ORG) leadership is chosen in closed - door conference meetings by secret ballot . cornyn(PERSON) was already making calls and reaching out to his fellow senators in the(TIME) hours(TIME) since mcconnell(PERSON) ’s announcement . 

republican(NORP) senators have n’t chosen a new leader since 2007(DATE) , when mcconnell(PERSON) was elected . that ’s before most current gop(ORG) senators took office . 

it is unclear which of the three(CARDINAL) “ johns(PERSON) ” would have an advantage among their peers . 

while cornyn(PERSON) is well liked and has drawn attention for his fundraising , thune(GPE) could have the advantage of incumbency , as mcconnell(PERSON) ’s current deputy . barrasso(PERSON) has tracked furthest to the right of the three(CARDINAL) , becoming the first(ORDINAL) of them to endorse former president donald(PERSON) trump(PERSON) for the gop(ORG) presidential nomination . 

thune and cornyn(PERSON) have criticized trump in the past , especially since the jan(DATE) .(DATE) 6(DATE) ,(DATE) 2021(DATE) , attack on the capitol by trump(PERSON) ’s supporters . but each eventually endorsed him as it became more likely that he will be the party ’s presidential nominee this(DATE) year(DATE) . 

[ senate(ORG) republicans(NORP) will face leadership struggle between trump and mcconnell(PERSON) camps ] 

there are certain to be other candidates , as well , including from the wing of the party that is closest to trump . 

florida(GPE) sen . rick(PERSON) scott(PERSON) challenged mcconnell(PERSON) in 2022(DATE) at trump(GPE) ’s urging , winning 10(CARDINAL) votes , and he could run again . scott(PERSON) has said he is focused on his own reelection bid this(DATE) year(DATE) , but has appeared open to a run after that . 

“ i think there ’s a better way to run the senate(ORG) , ” scott(PERSON) said after mcconnell(PERSON) ’s announcement . “ so we ’ll see what happens . ” 

on thursday(DATE) , scott(PERSON) said that he and sen . ron(PERSON) johnson(PERSON) , r - wisc . , will soon call for a special conference meeting to discuss the future of the party . 

the sudden scramble for the next leader comes as mcconnell(PERSON) , 82(DATE) , had faced louder and increasing criticism from some within his party who have said it is time for a change in leadership . they have criticized mcconnell(PERSON) ’s support for the huge end - of - year spending bills and , most recently , his outspoken backing for aid for ukraine(GPE) . a growing number in his conference has opposed the assistance , saying it would be better spent on the u.s.-mexico border or elsewhere within the u.s(GPE) .(GPE) 

the republican(NORP) leader was also at odds with trump , whom he has said was " practically and morally responsible " for the capitol attack . the two(CARDINAL) have n’t spoken since before then , and trump frequently bashes him publicly . 

mcconnell(PERSON) acknowledged his critics in his senate(ORG) floor speech announcing that he would step down from that role . 

“ believe me , i know the politics within my party at this particular moment in time , ” mcconnell(PERSON) said . “ i have many faults , misunderstanding politics is not one of them . ” 

he also echoed his critics , calling for a “ new generation ” to take over . 

in the(TIME) hours(TIME) after the announcement , as the surprise wore off , many senators praised mcconnell(PERSON) ’s legacy , including his role in the senate(ORG) confirmation of three(CARDINAL) conservative supreme(ORG) court(ORG) justices who tilted the court to the right . 

others were more focused on the future . 

“ this is a good development , ” said missouri(PERSON) sen(PERSON) . josh(PERSON) hawley(PERSON) , a frequent mcconnell(PERSON) critic . “ my question is : why wait so long ? ”

bear - burgers - opening : 

bear(ORG) burgers(ORG) is the newest culinary addition to mercer village . but it is more than just a restaurant ; it ’s a testament to resilience , community support and the pursuit of a dream . 

founded by jonathan(PERSON) and stephanie(PERSON) keene(PERSON) , this eatery emerged amid adversity , transforming setbacks into opportunities to create something truly special . the two(CARDINAL) faced homelessness at one(CARDINAL) point , but their grit and tenacity have been instrumental in creating multiple businesses . 

the journey to bear burger ’s began with “ keene ’s kafe(GPE) , ” a humble eatery tucked away in a shell gas station on thomaston road . the keenes faced challenges , including a summer(DATE) burglary that threatened the business ’s future . after the incident , there was an outpour of support from the community which played a pivotal role in shaping bear burger ’s destiny , jonathan(PERSON) keene(PERSON) said . 

“ a lot of the community supported me and wanted to see me open up a standalone location somewhere nearby . they knew as well as i did that that was n’t going to happen after the robbery , " keene said . " so generally speaking , that brought in a lot of support . my whole business model is if you love on people and treat them right , they got your back . ” 

this motivated the pair to move elsewhere . inspired by a desire to provide a welcoming space for mercer students , the couple opened the restaurant this(DATE) january(DATE) . 

“ when i was looking for where i thought a restaurant could make the most impact in macon , my wife and i came over to the mercer area and noticed there were no restaurant areas specifically tailored for mercer students , ” keene(PERSON) said . 

for keene , it was the unwavering support of the community , particularly the mercer community , that fueled their determination to persevere . recognizing the need for a dedicated space catering to mercer students , keene(PERSON) envisioned a new venture that would not only provide food but also cultivate a sense of belonging . 

“ this business is theirs . there is nowhere on or near campus , to me , where you can be a mercer student and feel more welcomed , positive , and cared for right when you walk in here . bear burgers , to me , will become a part of the mercer experience , ” keene(PERSON) said . 

beyond serving food , keene notes that he is dedicated to giving back to the mercer community . 

“ we are keying out ideas right now where every month , we ’ll have a competition where any student club , fraternity , or organization that is involved with a charity – however many people that they get to come here and eat that(DATE) month(DATE) , we ’ll give them 10(PERCENT) %(PERCENT) to their charity , ” keene(PERSON) said . 

as the restaurant continues to grow , jon(PERSON) and stephanie(PERSON) are excited for their time in mercer(GPE) village(GPE) . 

karisha(PERSON) khadayat(PERSON) is a student at mercer(ORG) university(ORG) and a contributing writer for the mercer cluster

quadruple murder refutes ‘ myth ’ that cannabis is safe , judge says 

- oops!something went wrong.please try again later . 

the case of a marijuana addict who murdered four(CARDINAL) people in a psychotic frenzy should be taken as a “ lesson to all those who peddle the myth that cannabis is not a dangerous drug ” , a judge has said . 

joshua(PERSON) jacques(PERSON) , 29(DATE) , stabbed to death his girlfriend , samantha(PERSON) drummonds(PERSON) , 27(DATE) , and three(CARDINAL) of her family members : mother tanysha(PERSON) ofori(PERSON) -(PERSON) akuffo(PERSON) , 45(DATE) , grandmother dolet(GPE) hill(GPE) , 64(DATE) , and her husband denton(PERSON) burke(PERSON) , 58(DATE) , in bermondsey(GPE) , south - east london(GPE) , on april(DATE) 25(DATE) 2022(DATE) . 

jacques(PERSON) butchered all four(CARDINAL) within the space of a single evening following a bout of “ self - intoxication ” with drugs and alcohol . 

prosecutors , during the trial in december(DATE) at the old bailey , described the scene as a “ bloodbath ” that would not have looked out of place in a horror film . 

immediately after the murders , jacques(PERSON) video(PERSON) -(PERSON) called his mother from a locked bathroom , telling her : “ i ’m ending it , i ’m gon na make a sacrifice . ” 

armed police who arrived at the scene were met with the sight of jacques(PERSON) naked and prostrate on the ground in a praying position , shouting , “ allah , take me ” , “ kill me now , ” “ get rid of me , ” and “ god please forgive me ” . 

on friday(DATE) , justice bryan(PERSON) handed the killer four(CARDINAL) life sentences with a minimum of 46(DATE) years(DATE) for the “ horrific catalogue of murders inflicted on three(CARDINAL) generations of the same family ” . 

‘ psychosis ’ 

the court heard how jacques(PERSON) had smoked cannabis since the(DATE) age(DATE) 12(DATE) and had doubled his consumption in the(DATE) week(DATE) running up to the killings . 

justice bryan(PERSON) , in sentencing , said : “ the tragedy that played out on 25(CARDINAL) april(DATE) 2022(DATE) is a salutary lesson to all those who peddle the myth that cannabis is not a dangerous drug . 

“ no one is suggesting that [ the murders ] were religiously motivated . you never intended to make any sacrifices of your victims . this was simply a symptom of your psychosis . 

“ you were well aware of the risks to your health of smoking skunk cannabis . you had doubled your consumption of cannabis in the(DATE) weeks(DATE) leading up to the killings . 

“ you may have consumed seven(QUANTITY) grams(QUANTITY) of cannabis a day immediately before the killing . ” 

dr(PERSON) nigel(PERSON) blackwood(PERSON) , a forensic psychiatrist for the prosecution , said the symptoms of manic behaviour displayed were caused by the large amount of cannabis jacques(PERSON) had consumed . 

jacques(PERSON) had been hospitalised in a psychiatric ward in 2018(DATE) and diagnosed with bipolar disorder . 

he had denied four(CARDINAL) counts of murder , but jurors convicted him on each charge after a trial last(DATE) december(DATE) . 

explaining his decision not to impose a whole - life sentence , justice bryan(PERSON) said jacques(PERSON) was unlikely to pose the same risk to the public in his(DATE) seventies(DATE) . 

“ a very substantial minimum term will amount to a just punishment , ” he said . 

previous convictions 

the court heard jacques(PERSON) has 11(CARDINAL) convictions for 20(CARDINAL) offences , including conspiracy to supply drugs . 

paul(PERSON) raudnitz(PERSON) kc(PERSON) , defending , claimed there was no “ premeditation ” before jacques(PERSON) carried out the murders . 

“ the critical distinction between this case and those where the court would see fit to say that a whole - life sentence is merited is an absence of premeditation . ” 

mr raudnitz(PERSON) read a note to the court in which jacques(PERSON) apologised for what he had done . 

“ i would like to say to the family of the deceased that i am truly and sincerely sorry for all the heartache i have caused them . 

“ i am disgusted with myself . i can not believe that i am the cause of this monstrosity . ”

dripping-springs-isd-response-playground-225440877.html(PERSON) : 

dripping springs isd(ORG) ’s response to playground sexual assault upsets parent 

editor ’s note : this story features an account of alleged sexual assault against minors . kxan(GPE) has withheld the names and identifying information for the privacy of those involved . if you are in distress or need someone to talk to , please call rainn(PERSON) ’s national sexual assault hotline at 1(CARDINAL) -(CARDINAL) 800(CARDINAL) -(CARDINAL) 656(CARDINAL) -(CARDINAL) 4673(CARDINAL) . 

dripping(PERSON) springs(PERSON) , texas(GPE) ( kxan(GPE) ) — a dripping springs isd(ORG) mother describes an oct(DATE) .(DATE) 20(DATE) family dinner with her elementary student in heart - breaking detail . 

during nightly(TIME) family dinners , she , her husband and children do “ highs and lows ” — each tells the others about the best moment and worst moment from their(DATE) day(DATE) . 

“ i do n’t have a high for the(DATE) day(DATE) , ” said one(CARDINAL) of her children . 

“ we kept calm in the moment , ” said the mom , after learning her child ’s low for the(DATE) day(DATE) . “ i just kept thinking , ‘ what the f — happened to them ? ' ” 

the incident 

according to the mom , her child and another student were both on the playground at recess . she believes five(CARDINAL) teachers and more(CARDINAL) than(CARDINAL) 100(CARDINAL) other students were also on the large playground . security cameras were mounted around the area to monitor the students . 

the two(CARDINAL) students , who knew each other from prior grades , were under a play structure and visible to teachers and cameras , according to the mom . 

“ we ’re going to play vet , ” said the other student . 

according to the mom , her child said that ’s when the other student reached into her child ’s pants . the mom said that the other student then sexually assaulted her child . 

her child told their parents that they told a teacher , but the mom said no one from the school contacted her . she said they only learned what happened when her child told the family during dinner . 

after checking their child for injuries , the mom said they contacted a pediatrician , a child psychologist and the school . since the incident , she said their child has received medical care and therapy . 

the investigation 

the school responded to the mom the(DATE) next(DATE) day(DATE) . it told her that a “ stay away ” order was put in place for the two(CARDINAL) students and that it verbally communicated the order to relevant teachers and staff . 

the parents and school administrators met on oct(DATE) .(DATE) 23(DATE) . the mom said school officials presented two(CARDINAL) options at that meeting : an internal investigation by the school district or a title ix complaint investigation . the mom said school officials told them that if a title ix complaint was filed , then details about what happened and the names of everyone involved would be public information . 

the mom said they filed a title ix complaint on the(DATE) same(DATE) day(DATE) . 

kxan(GPE) has filed a public information request for more information on the title ix investigation . 

the mom said that on nov(DATE) .(DATE) 7(DATE) , investigators interviewed the two(CARDINAL) students and another child who had witnessed what happened . according to the mom , those interviews corroborated her child ’s story . she also said that the district deemed video footage “ too grainy ” to tell what happened , but it also could n’t show them the footage , saying it had automatically been deleted after 16(DATE) days(DATE) . 

according to the mom , the investigation closed on nov(DATE) .(DATE) 20(DATE) and concluded that the other child did sexually assault her child . 

“ this happened in broad daylight , ” the mom said . “ where were the teachers ? is anyone being held accountable ? is anyone looking into the other student ’s safety ? ” 

jennifer(PERSON) edwards(PERSON) , the executive director of communication with dripping springs(PERSON) isd(PERSON) , told kxan(GPE) the , “ parents of the students who were involved were immediately notified of the incident as well as the hays county sheriff ’s office and child protective services . ” dripping springs(PERSON) isd(PERSON) did not give details on the alleged incident or the title ix investigation . 

the(DATE) day(DATE) the investigation closed , the mom said the district told the parents and their child to sign a new order for their child to stay away from the other child . this upset the mom , who feels that signing the order would make her child feel like they did something wrong . 

edwards(PERSON) tells kxan(GPE) that “ state and federal laws protecting student privacy do not allow the district to provide specific details about this incident . ” 

the outcome 

after the investigation , the mom said she asked their child ’s teacher about the stay - away order and to report any changes in their child ’s well - being or behavior . 

“ the teacher said they did n’t even know about the order , ” the mom said . “ the isd(ORG) said it would n’t release a notice to parents about the assault because it would be a ferpa ( family educational rights and privacy act ) violation . ” 

since then , the parents spoke with other parents , rallying others to support reforming district policies . 

“ it breaks my heart , ” the mom said . “ the policies in place are n’t good enough . we used to not have to lock doors at schools , but because of school shootings , we have to now . something needs to change . we have to do things different . ” 

the mom , along with 10(CARDINAL) other parents , met with dripping springs isd(ORG) and school leaders on friday(DATE) ,(DATE) march(DATE) 1(DATE) . they went armed with talking points : what is staff required to do if a student under the(DATE) age(DATE) of(DATE) 10(DATE) tells about a sexual assault ? how will the isd(ORG) support victims ? how does the school teach students about boundaries and abuse ? 

“ children deserve a trauma - informed and victim - centered response by the school system : asking a victim to sign stay - away documents appears to demonstrate a lack of understanding of proper child development , ” reads the talking points shared by the mom . “ being asked to sign a document may be interpreted by the child that they have done something wrong , which is a common feeling expressed by children who have experienced abuse and often keeps them from disclosing . ” 

she said her focus is on preventing other parents and students from experiencing what happened to her family . 

“ it ’s an uncomfortable conversation that a school district does n’t want to have . but we need to have it , ” the mom said . “ i just hope the district does n’t retaliate against us because i ’m advocating for my child . ” 

the meeting 

according to the mom , the friday(DATE) meeting felt like a “ step in the right direction , ” with leaders apologizing for perceived missteps in the process . 

“ it ’s going to be a journey , but i think they ’re willing to take appropriate steps , ” she said . 

the mom said the group received verbal commitments from district leaders at the meeting , including : 

new security cameras , already funded through state grants for school security 

better zoning and patrolling by adults supervising students during recess 

the expansion of opt - in abuse prevention training to k-5 students 

according to her , meeting attendees also discussed having further discussions with the district about safety policies . 

dripping springs(PERSON) isd(PERSON) provided a statement to kxan(GPE) friday(DATE) afternoon(TIME) : 

the safety of the students of dripping springs isd(ORG) is the district ’s first(ORDINAL) and most important priority . our staff takes all reports of harm to students seriously and investigates incidents fully to determine the actions necessary to ensure the safety of all students . the incident was immediately reported to law enforcement and child protective services . the district ’s title ix coordinator was notified and the appropriate procedures were followed in accordance with federal law . 

jennifer(PERSON) edwards(PERSON) , dripping springs(ORG) isd(ORG) executive director of communications 

kxan(GPE) also asked dripping springs isd(ORG) officials if they intended to change any policies as a result of the investigation . 

“ the district regularly reviews its policies and practices in order to best serve the students and families of dsisd(GPE) ; however , the district did not identify any concerns in the handling of this matter by campus administration , ” said edwards(PERSON) in response to kxan(GPE) ’s question . “ the campus took appropriate action to inform and support the involved families and ensure the safety of all students . ” 

when told about the district ’s response , the mom was surprised and disappointed , calling it an “ unfortunate inconsistency . ” 

“ this will make parents more upset , ” the mom said . “ i guess we ’re back to square one if they do n’t think things need to change . ” 

kxan(GPE) followed up with edwards(PERSON) about those answers . she reiterated that the district did not identify any missteps or mistakes in its process , calling the mom ’s account of the friday(DATE) meeting “ inaccurate . ” 

“ in our investigation of how the administration handled the incident , the district did not identify any missteps or mistakes . as stated , the district is always willing to review our policies and procedures in an effort to improve operations and student safety , ” edwards(PERSON) said .

former president donald(PERSON) trump(PERSON) has unleashed a fiery attack on fulton(ORG) co.(ORG) district attorney fani(PERSON) willis as a judge considers whether she should be removed from prosecuting the georgia(GPE) election interference case , radaronline.com has learned . 

trump , along with his co - defendants , has raised concerns about a purported inappropriate relationship between willis and special prosecutor nathan(PERSON) wade(PERSON) , which they claim led to financial benefits for willis . 

during a court session , an attorney representing one(CARDINAL) of trump(PERSON) 's co - defendants , robert(PERSON) cheeley(PERSON) , made a striking comparison , stating that willis and wade behaved like " love - struck teenagers , " exchanging thousands(CARDINAL) of calls and messages . 

the allegations of impropriety have prompted trump to take to his truth social account to express his strong disapproval and call for the dismissal of the case altogether . 

in an angry , all - capped post , trump(PERSON) questioned the source of funds that allegedly benefited willis and wade , asking his 6.6(CARDINAL) million(CARDINAL) followers , " where did fani(PERSON) get all that cash ? no way she paid her lover , ' prosecutor '(PERSON) nathan(PERSON) wade(PERSON) , back . "

allen had been back with the department for about(DATE) two(DATE) years(DATE) , dustman(ORG) said , after having left law enforcement for other work . 

but allen(PERSON) realized " he missed it , " dustman said , and returned to a calling that was ingrained in him . 

the civil process server who was killed worked for the 16th(ORDINAL) circuit court of jackson(GPE) county(GPE) . authorities identified him as drexel(ORG) mack(ORG) .(ORG) 

mack(PERSON) called 911(CARDINAL) for help , authorities said . 

two(CARDINAL) other independence police officers were wounded but are expected to make full recoveries , dustman(ORG) said . 

a male suspect was in custody , authorities said .

new - training - center - seeks - to - grow - prescribed - fire - capacity : 

new western training center seeks to grow prescribed fire capacity 

prescribed fire is an effective tool to make catastrophic wildfires less likely , and now federal land management agencies are expanding training for those important burns . 

in a recent forest service strategy document , officials are blunt about the situation they face . 

“ the prescribed fire implementation environment continues to grow in complexity , whereas the ability of practitioners to practice and hone their expertise has lagged , particularly in the western united states , ” it reads . 

but a new program - the western prescribed fire training center - seeks to address that training gap . the first(ORDINAL) class is already burning and receiving training in oklahoma(GPE) . a national interagency prescribed fire training center already exists in tallahassee(GPE) , florida(GPE) , where over(QUANTITY) 1(QUANTITY) million(QUANTITY) acres(QUANTITY) were burned in 2021(DATE) . the western center is conceived of as an expansion of that program . 

classrooms for training will be set up near prescribed fires in existing offices , or other locations , according to the strategy . federal officials hope the effort will “ increase the pace of prescribed fire training - to - qualification in the(GPE) western(GPE) united(GPE) states(GPE) , provide trainees real - time experience in different fuel types and terrain , and ultimately increase national prescribed fire resource capacity . ” 

additional sessions will be held this(DATE) year(DATE) in boise , flagstaff(ORG) and elsewhere , according to alex(PERSON) robertson(PERSON) , the acting director of fire and aviation at the forest service ’s d.c(GPE) .(GPE) office . 

he said that increasing the amount of prescribed burning is all about taking advantage of the windows that mother nature provides . 

“ and if we 're not nimble enough , if we 're not prepared enough , if we 're not skilled enough to take advantage of every window , we 're not going to get more done , ” he said . 

robertson(PERSON) said that doing the training at sites around the west will give trainees experience with different fuel types and “ different politics around prescribed fire in different communities . ” 

this story was produced by the mountain west news bureau , a collaboration between wyoming public media , nevada(GPE) public radio , boise(ORG) state(ORG) public radio in idaho(GPE) , kunr(GPE) in nevada(GPE) , kunc in colorado(GPE) and kanw in new(GPE) mexico(GPE) , with support from affiliate stations across the region . funding for the mountain west news bureau is provided in part by the corporation for public broadcasting .

email - reprimanding - napping - students - at - malachowsky - hall - brings - backlash : 

on feb(DATE) .(DATE) 7(DATE) , around(CARDINAL) 50(CARDINAL) students received an email whose first(ORDINAL) line read , “ we appreciate how hard our faculty and students work , but it ’s malachowsky(PERSON) hall(PERSON) , not malachowsky hotel . ” 

it referenced students sleeping in the graduate student village in malachowsky(FAC) hall(FAC) and included two(CARDINAL) photos of the culprits . 

the email was sent by david(PERSON) arnold(PERSON) , professor and associate chair for faculty affairs at the(ORG) department(ORG) of(ORG) electrical(ORG) and computer engineering . he wrote that multiple students had been sleeping in meeting booths on the fourth(ORDINAL) floor of the building . 

if students continue to use the space for sleeping , they may have their access to the student villages — located on the fourth(ORDINAL) floor — revoked , according to the message . 

the message finished by telling students to reach out to their advisers and arnold(PERSON) himself if they feel stressed or overworked . 

“ we want to ensure a healthy working environment for all our students and employees , ” arnold(PERSON) wrote . 

what surprised students the most was the two(CARDINAL) photos of students sleeping attached to the email as evidence of the situation . 

a screenshot of the email circulated on the unofficial uf reddit page . throughout the(DATE) week(DATE) , students expressed concern and frustration toward the email ’s tone . the original post that contained the screenshot of the email has since been taken down . 

agustin(NORP) giraldo(PERSON) , a 24(DATE) -(DATE) year(DATE) -(DATE) old(DATE) uf computer science major , spends anywhere from three(TIME) to(TIME) 20(TIME) hours(TIME) a week at malachowsky(ORG) hall(ORG) for classes , studying and club meetings . he enjoys how productive malachowsky makes him feel , but the unclear restrictions and the lack of vending machines can get frustrating , he said . 

he found out about the email through reddit . he was mainly caught off guard when he saw the photos attached to the email . 

“ it was unreasonable to take someone ’s picture without their consent , especially if they ’re sleeping , ” giraldo(PERSON) said . “ if you want to reiterate why that was bad , those photos were unnecessary . ” after reading the email , his perception of the building changed . 

“ is it an academic center , or is it a business center ? ” he said . “ what exactly is the purpose of malachowsky if it was n’t for students or graduate students ? ” 

he ’s realized that many rooms stay locked and require special key access . he recently found out that he could n’t stay studying later(TIME) in(TIME) the(TIME) night(TIME) because a security guard approached him around(TIME) 8(TIME) p.m.(TIME) and informed him students could n’t be in the building past a(TIME) certain(TIME) hour(TIME) . 

ivan(PERSON) ruchkin(PERSON) , an engineering professor , was surprised when he first(ORDINAL) received the email . some of his students asked him about it , he said . 

“ they were trying to get a sense of both the reasoning and the rationale behind it , ” he said . 

he understands situations need to be reported , he said , especially when students can spend any time between(DATE) three(DATE) and(DATE) 50(DATE) hours(DATE) a week in malachowsky(GPE) hall(GPE) . 

the scope of the email went beyond current graduate students , toward whom the email was geared . 

joseph(PERSON) melville(PERSON) , 32(DATE) , was sent the email despite having graduated last(DATE) year(DATE) . when he was a student , malachowsky(PERSON) hall(PERSON) had n’t opened yet . he remembered being skeptical about the open floor plan because the clear doors and rooms could get in the way of graduate assistants ’ privacy . 

“ it was funny in a slightly sad way , ” melville(GPE) said about the email . 

melville(GPE) was part of the graduate student wellness committee for the electrical and computer engineering department . 

“ it ’s hard to say exactly what needs to be done , ” melville(GPE) said . “ professors have their needs that need to be met also . ” 

while he is no longer a student , he said there is still a lot to be done to make sure rules and expectations are as transparent as possible . 

while resources exist to help graduate assistants , there ’s little awareness that they exist , melville(GPE) said . to him , the main problem is that “ students felt like they were n’t listened to enough . ” 

shayan(ORG) hadjiabadi(ORG) , a 27(DATE) -(DATE) year(DATE) -(DATE) old(DATE) uf genetics and plant breeding graduate student , spends up(TIME) to(TIME) six(TIME) hours(TIME) a week in malachowsky(ORG) hall(ORG) and enjoys the graduate student room . he heard about the email after a cohort member forwarded it to him . 

the email was “ just very confusing , ” hadjiabadi(PERSON) said . 

“ i ’ve seen people sleeping just like i see people sleeping in marston(ORG) and lib west , ” he said . “ i ’ve never thought twice about it . ” 

it was n’t the first(ORDINAL) time he ’d heard about instances of students clashing with building administrators . 

“ there were solitary incidents where people were spoken to personally face - to - face , not in a mass email setting , ” he said . “ it ’s pretty unusual to see an email that ’s so pointed . ” 

mark(PERSON) tehranipoir(PERSON) , the chair of the(ORG) department(ORG) of(ORG) electrical(ORG) and computer engineering , wrote in an email that custodial staff originally brought the issue to the attention of the college ’s leadership . he wrote that the email ’s intent was never to be insensitive . 

“ on friday(DATE) afternoon(TIME) , department leadership met with students to reset the conversation , listen to their concerns and work together on finding solutions , ” he wrote . 

according to him , the meeting was productive . 

he wrote that graduate - level engineering is very demanding , but he ’s committed to making malachowsky a supportive learning environment . ”

john(PERSON) rich(PERSON) has become a divisive figure online and now a post he has made about guns has gone viral . 

the country musician has taken to x ( formerly twitter ) to share his thoughts on gun control , referring to jfk(PERSON) when doing so . 

" when kennedy(PERSON) was shot , nobody blamed the gun , " he wrote . at the time of writing , the post had been viewed 761,100(CARDINAL) times . 

people took to rich 's post to criticize him for his take , with many disagreeing with what he said . 

newsweek(ORG) contacted a spokesperson for rich via email friday(DATE) for comment . 

" uh , you should probably just shut up now , " one(CARDINAL) person wrote . 

" hey genius — when has anyone blamed guns when it 's not a mass shooting ? " someone else asked . 

" kennedy(PERSON) could n't have been shot if there was n't a gun , " another person commented . 

a fourth(ORDINAL) added : " when jfk(PERSON) was shot , everyone and everything was blamed . " 

others took to the comments to show their support for rich . 

" the good gentleman has a point , " a different x user said . 

" democrats(NORP) had not been taken over by crazy people yet , " wrote another . 

" good point , but nowadays no one takes the blame , it is always someone else , and this shows in the current leadership as well , " someone else commented . 

while rich did n't clarify what his post was in response to , it comes amid renewed calls for stricter gun laws after a woman was killed and 22(CARDINAL) people were injured in a mass shooting at the(DATE) end(DATE) of(DATE) the(DATE) february(DATE) 14(DATE) parade to celebrate the kansas(GPE) city chiefs ' super bowl win in kansas(GPE) city(GPE) . 

it occurred on the sixth(ORDINAL) anniversary of the 2018(DATE) shooting at marjory(FAC) stoneman(FAC) douglas(FAC) high school in parkland , florida(GPE) , in which 14(CARDINAL) students and three(CARDINAL) staff members were killed . 

gun violence continues to claim lives at a high rate in the(GPE) united(GPE) states(GPE) . more(CARDINAL) than(CARDINAL) 4,800(CARDINAL) people have died in shootings so far in 2024(DATE) , at(CARDINAL) least(CARDINAL) 2,100(CARDINAL) of them in homicides or accidental incidents , according to the gun violence archive . 

on february(DATE) 17(DATE) , president joe(PERSON) biden(PERSON) noted that there had been more mass shootings in 2024(DATE) " than there have been days(DATE) in the(DATE) year(DATE) . " 

for the joy of the parade to be turned into tragedy " cuts deep in the american(NORP) soul , " the president said in a statement . 

he called on people to press congress(ORG) to ban assault weapons , to limit high - capacity gun magazines , strengthen background checks and " keep guns out of the hands of those who have no business owning them or handling them . "

202403020052.html(CARDINAL) : 

as external actors seem to lessen pressure on west(GPE) africa(GPE) 's(GPE) juntas(ORG) , guineans(NORP) register their discontent with military governance . 

from one(CARDINAL) perspective , the(DATE) past(DATE) week(DATE) has been a success for military rulers in west(GPE) africa(GPE) . the economic community of west(NORP) african(NORP) states ( ecowas ) , announced the easing of sanctions on niger(GPE) , mali(PERSON) , and guinea , backing down from earlier efforts to draw a hard line against unconstitutional transfers of power in the region . while the regional bloc 's decision may not be sufficient to bring the so - called alliance of sahel states ( consisting of mali(NORP) , burkina(GPE) faso , and niger(GPE) ) back into the fold , it can still be seen as a validation of the juntas(ORG) ' determination to resist external pressure . 

internal pressure is another story entirely . instead of celebrating the ecowas decision , guineans(NORP) were expressing their deep dissatisfaction with the government ecowas was attempting to placate . a national strike began on monday(DATE) as trade unions demanded not just better wages , but an end to internet restrictions and the release of the secretary general of the(ORG) union(ORG) of(ORG) press(ORG) professionals(ORG) . in some areas , demonstrators clashed with security forces , a far cry from the exuberant masses that came out to cheer mamady doumbouya(PERSON) and his uniformed comrades when they overthrew the government in 2021(DATE) . 

it 's clear that the junta is under pressure . on february(DATE) 20(DATE) , doumbouya(PERSON) abruptly dissolved the transitional government and sealed the country 's borders . a(DATE) week(DATE) later(DATE) came a decree that former opposition leader mamadou(PERSON) bah(PERSON) had been appointed prime minister . the general strike has now been suspended , but popular dissatisfaction with the cost of living and demands for greater civil and political rights will persist . 

the change that the military leaders promoted as they ousted former president alpha conde -- following his manipulation of the constitutional and electoral landscape to devise a third(ORDINAL) term -- has been harder to deliver than it was to promise . for all of doumbouya(PERSON) 's pan(NORP) -(NORP) african(NORP) posturing in international fora , he has been unable to perform any heroics for the population he supposedly serves . since june(DATE) , guineans(NORP) have taken to the streets to protest against the military regime , sometimes at the cost of their lives . it 's worth watching what happens now that the bloom is off the rose . the resistance of guineans(NORP) is just as significant a signal of what african(NORP) populations want as the initial reactions to military seizures of power .

in 2021(DATE) , washburn(ORG) would eventually sue the city of davenport(GPE) and win about(MONEY) $(MONEY) 260,000(MONEY) as part of a settlement of a lawsuit filed by the former fire chief who alleged she was discriminated against because of her age and gender . the city ’s insurance carrier travelers insurance settled the lawsuit without city(ORG) council(ORG) approval , as allowed under the city ’s policy . davenport(GPE) mayor mike(PERSON) matson(PERSON) said he would have preferred to have the case go to court . “ we are disappointed . we were looking forward to a public trial on this matter , ” city attorney tom(PERSON) warner(PERSON) stated .

the - long - forgotten - story - of-73 - children - kidnapped - by - pirates - that - created - international - headlines : 

when 73(CARDINAL) british(NORP) , american(NORP) , and scandinavian(NORP) children boarded a steamboat in shanghai(GPE) on january(DATE) 29(DATE) ,(DATE) 1935(DATE) , little they did they know that they would soon be fated to meet a notorious band of pirates who had harassed the chinese(NORP) coast for decades(DATE) . 

one(CARDINAL) of the last significant pirate strongholds , bias bay lies in the southern coast of guangdong(GPE) province(GPE) in southern(LOC) china(LOC) , not too far from hong(GPE) kong(GPE) . the bias bay pirates were led by the female pirate lai(PERSON) choi(PERSON) san(PERSON) , who is believed to have had thousands(CARDINAL) of chinese(NORP) junk ships at her command . one(CARDINAL) such ship would cause global attention . 

the pirates attack 

when the steamboat known as the(ORG) ss(ORG) tungchow(ORG) embarked from shanghai(GPE) , it was expected to dock in yantai within a(DATE) day(DATE) , where most of its passengers — 73(CARDINAL) kids of various ages — would be studying at the chinese(NORP) inland ’s missions school , also known as the(ORG) chefoo(ORG) school(ORG) , whose purpose was to provide an education for the children of foreign missionaries and businessmen . most of those foreign families lived in shanghai(GPE) , so this was a return trip for the children after visiting their respective families . 

at 6(TIME) pm(TIME) on that tuesday(DATE) night of january 29 , shortly after the passengers had finished their dinner , a lone , unthreatening junk ship appeared nearby , but a commotion on deck earned the attention of the guards ; a shot rang out as several passengers of the tungchow suddenly drew firearms and started barking orders . these gun - wielding assailants were pirates , and had boarded the ship in shanghai(GPE) alongside other passengers . as they made their move , the junk ship came closer and rode alongside the steamboat uncontested , its hidden cannons not required . 

overall , only(CARDINAL) 13(CARDINAL) pirates total boarded the tungchow(ORG) , but that ’s all the manpower they needed . 

mr . k.(PERSON) macdonald(PERSON) , the second(ORDINAL) engineer for the steamboat , immediately rushed out of his cabin upon hearing the alarm . he was met by the pirates , and gunfire ensued . shot in the chest , macdonald(PERSON) nevertheless somehow lived to tell the tale of the attack . 

two(CARDINAL) of the four(CARDINAL) russian(NORP) guards of the ship were also shot , including one who had fought against four(CARDINAL) of the pirates . multiple accounts claim he was still alive some(TIME) 20(TIME) minutes(TIME) later(TIME) , but was then brutally killed . the other guard who was shot survived . the other two(CARDINAL) guards were overwhelmed and taken captive by the pirates along with the other passengers , including the children . the captives were then held in the ship ’s saloon . 

fool ’s gold 

the pirates had acted so swiftly that they had already taken the radio operator hostage , preventing any word from getting out . they had quickly taken the captain hostage also , and stormed the engine room . 

one(CARDINAL) uncredited account detailed what happened next , which reveals what the pirates were after : 

“ ordered to unlock the door of the strong - room , the purser did so without the slightest reluctance , but so eager were the pirates to see the gold that they delayed him by trying to speed him up with nudgings of their guns . finally the heavy , burglar - proof steel door swung open , with a dismal groan which was echoed by even more dismal ones from the pirates when they saw that it contained nothing , not even a speck of dust . ” 

the pirates , furiously disappointed upon realizing they had been lied to , needed to decide what to do next . they could leave with only the money they took from each passenger , as well as some random loot from the ship — or they could take hostages . they decided to steer the ship south towards bias bay , which was a(DATE) couple(DATE) days(DATE) away . with 73(CARDINAL) children held captive , surely a significant ransom would be paid . thus , they departed the yellow sea and headed for the south(LOC) china(LOC) sea(LOC) . 

once in bias bay , they would be safe from the authorities and in their own den of pirates , including the ruthless lai choi san herself . 

the tungchow(ORG) disappears 

when the ship was nearly(DATE) a(DATE) day(DATE) late(DATE) to arrive at its destination of yantai , the port informed authorities . 

all ships were then on the lookout for the tungchow , but two(DATE) days(DATE) passed without a single sighting , despite the chinese(NORP) and british(NORP) governments reacting by sending out ships in a desperate search for the steamboat , while also informing others in the waters . the british(NORP) and the chinese(NORP) assumed there was a chance that if the tungchow(ORG) had been taken over by pirates , then it would be headed to bias bay , but even along that sea route , there was no sign of the tungchow . it was as if the ship had completely disappeared . did it sink ? did it vanish ? 

as it turns out , the pirates did make the tungchow disappear . no , it was n’t magic . 

once the pirates decided to stay on the ship and head to bias bay , they employed a clever plan ; they painted the ship ’s funnel red , and also painted over the name “ ss(PERSON) tungchow(PERSON) . ” they even repainted a new name , “ toa(ORG) maru(ORG) , ” onto the ship . 

hence , the tungchow sailed through busy waters unspotted . it even passed numerous ships that were looking for it , including within close range of a searching british(NORP) vessel ; the pirates succeeded in completely disguising the ship . it no longer fit the description of the tungchow , and did not bear its name . the(ORG) toa(ORG) maru(ORG) was not just a random name , either ; it was the name of a known ship , one that had been recently restored near hong(GPE) kong(GPE) . 

the pirate chief and the children 

as the 13(CARDINAL) pirates , led by an unnamed chief , controlled the ship and its passengers , they at least made sure everyone was fed . when one(CARDINAL) adult passenger , described as “ a pompous man with a large mustache , ” complained that he did n’t have enough to eat , the pirates would poke him with their guns . the man also behaved miserably towards the children , saying he believed they should all keep quiet . the pirate chief noticed that the children were rather delighted at seeing the pirates trouble the man , so he made sure to nudge him whenever he spoke as a way to keep him quiet , instead . 

mr . pj(PERSON) duncan(PERSON) , the master in charge of the 73(CARDINAL) children — and whose detailed account was cited in newspapers around the world in the(DATE) following(DATE) months(DATE) — pointed out the unique relationship that formed between the chief and the children . 

the pirate chief took a liking to the youngsters , because instead of being afraid of him , they were in awe . they had never seen a real life pirate before , and their adventurous spirits were too star - struck to understand the gravity of the situation . despite the pirates having shot three(CARDINAL) men , killing one , the children were admiring observers of a real - life pirate movie unfolding before their eyes . 

the pirate chief would often grab oranges stored on the ship , and toss them to the children only . he even found candy stored on the ship , and give the children treats . he entertained them with his pirate stories , and his rather unusual upbringing of being raised by a pirate to be a pirate , which many in bias bay were . it ’s likely that this pirate chief — only described as “ fairly young ” by duncan(PERSON) — never met such a delighted audience for his tales outside of bias bay . 

the(ORG) british(ORG) navy(ORG) near bias bay 

a(DATE) month(DATE) earlier(DATE) , a british(NORP) carrier named hermes(ORG) had stationed itself in hong(GPE) kong(GPE) . when authorities were notified of the missing steamboat with many british(NORP) children aboard , the(ORG) british(ORG) navy(ORG) quickly reacted , and hermes(PERSON) was immediately dispatched . 

at noon(TIME) on friday(DATE) ,(DATE) february(DATE) 1(DATE) , aircraft from the(ORG) hermes(ORG) spotted a steamboat just outside bias bay , seemingly headed towards a location known to be a pirate den . the pilots realized it could be the tungchow in disguise , and they were right . 

the pirates , upon realizing they ’d been spotted , quickly hopped onto a lifeboat with two(CARDINAL) adult hostages in order to prevent the aircraft from firing . they had made off with some loot from the steamboat , also . they were n’t alerted of any aircraft search ahead of time because they had , regrettably , destroyed the tungchow(ORG) ’s communications . the pirates then headed for a small island nearby . upon reaching shore , they left the hostages there . once the surveilling aircraft departed , the pirates sailed away to a larger boat of their own , and raced safely to bias bay before more help arrived to take the tungchow home . 

the only life lost in the affair was that of the russian(NORP) guard , whose name was only published as “ tchornoff . ” all other passengers survived . none of the 73(CARDINAL) children were harmed . 

the pirate chief bids farewell to the children 

when the pirate chief initially departed the tungchow(ORG) on the lifeboat , he turned around to face the children , all 73(CARDINAL) of whom were looking at him . he flamboyantly bowed towards them , as a theater actor might after giving a performance worthy of a standing ovation . as the lifeboat reached closer to the shore , he turned around again to offer another bow , but the children had all dashed to the other side of the tungchow in an attempt to grab the pirate chief ’s sweater , which he had unintentionally left on board . in doing so , they accidentally ripped it to pieces , and thus many kept a small piece to themselves . 

spared were the children from meeting the leader of all pirates , lai(PERSON) choi(PERSON) san(PERSON) . 

was the pirate chief really going to keep the children hostages in bias bay ? one(CARDINAL) account claims that the pirates had already boarded a lifeboat and had began heading to the small island before any aircraft were spotted . if true , then why leave the children there ? did the children ’s admiration for the pirate make him have a change of heart ? one can only assume or , perhaps more accurately , believe that the tale deserves such an ending . 

during the ordeal , and most especially afterwards , newspapers around the globe reported the occurrence . this article was pieced together by reading all known accounts of the incident , including detailed reports in the san(GPE) francisco(GPE) examiner , the(ORG) pittsburgh(ORG) sun(ORG) -(ORG) telegraph(ORG) , and the(ORG) liverpool(ORG) daily(ORG) post(ORG) , amongst many other newspapers .

auto insurance costs to rise 7(PERCENT) %(PERCENT) this(DATE) year(DATE) after 24(PERCENT) %(PERCENT) hike in 2023(DATE) , new report finds 

tampa(GPE) , fla(GPE) . - auto insurance premiums in florida(GPE) , already the third(ORDINAL) highest in the nation , are expected to rise again in 2024(DATE) , according to a new report from insurance comparison site insurify . 

" after a(DATE) year(DATE) of staggering rate hikes , drivers will see smaller , but still significant increases in 2024(DATE) as the insurance industry stabilizes , " the report found .

" in 2022(DATE) , hurricane ian(PERSON) caused $(MONEY) 109.5(MONEY) billion(MONEY) worth of damage in florida(GPE) , making it the costliest hurricane in the state ’s history , according to the noaa(ORG) . 

already strapped insurance companies have struggled to stay profitable in the aftermath . the state now faces an insurance crisis , with multiple insurers increasing rates or halting new policies in the state . among the companies that pulled back , farmers exited florida(GPE) , affecting approximately(CARDINAL) 100,000(CARDINAL) customers , and aaa(PERSON) declined certain policy renewals . " 

the report cites rampant insurance fraud as a driving factor behind rising florida(GPE) rates in 2023(DATE) .

a-68412409 : 

navalny buried at moscow(GPE) cemetery after prison deathpublished march(DATE) 1(DATE) , 2024last updated march(DATE) 1(DATE) ,(DATE) 2024(DATE) 

thousands(CARDINAL) of people turned out in moscow(GPE) for the funeral of russian(NORP) opposition politician alexei navalny on friday(DATE) . 

many carried flowers and shouted support for the man who was one(CARDINAL) of president vladimir(PERSON) putin(PERSON) 's fiercest critics . 

russian(NORP) security forces maintained a significant presence at the church of the icon of the mother of god soothe my sorrows , a russian(NORP) orthodox church , and the borisovskoye cemetery , where navalny was laid to rest . 

navalny died at the(DATE) age(DATE) of(DATE) 47(DATE) under mysterious circumstances during his imprisonment at a remote prison camp on february(DATE) 16(DATE) . 

support for the prominent putin(PERSON) critic 

earlier , as his coffin was carried into the church by four(CARDINAL) pallbearers , some outside chanted : " navalny , navalny ! " people also shouted , " you were n't afraid , neither are we ! " and later " no to war ! " 

some people openly protested against russian(NORP) president vladimir(PERSON) putin(PERSON) shouting " russia(GPE) without putin(PERSON) ! " " putin(PERSON) is a murderer ! " " russia(GPE) will be free ! " 

following the service , his coffin was again carried out of the church to applause and more chanting from the crowds as the short journey to the cemetery began . 

a photo from inside the church showed an open casket with navalny 's body covered with red and white flowers , as his mother , wearing a black headscarf and with a candle in one hand , sat alongside his father nearby . 

navalny 's wife , yulia(PERSON) navalnaya(PERSON) , who did not return to russia(GPE) for the funeral , posted a video tribute to her husband on social media thanking him for " 26(DATE) years(DATE) of absolute happiness . " 

western diplomats , including german(NORP) ambassador alexander(PERSON) graf(PERSON) lambsdorff(PERSON) , us(GPE) ambassador lynn(PERSON) tracy(PERSON) and french(NORP) ambassador pierre(PERSON) levy(PERSON) also attended the service . 

boris(PERSON) nadezhdin and yekaterina(PERSON) duntsova(PERSON) , anti - war politicians who had attempted to run against putin(PERSON) in this month(DATE) 's presidential election but were not allowed on the ballot , also attended the funeral . 

nadezhdin(PERSON) told dw that navalny 's death was a tragedy and emphasized that his name is still " symbolic " for millions(CARDINAL) of russians(NORP) : " look at the queue waiting here to say goodbye to him . " 

in a telegram message , duntsova(ORG) wrote , " he will never see spring again , because here , where he left , he got winter(DATE) and the permafrost of the(LOC) arctic(LOC) circle(LOC) , and there , where he is going , there will only be eternal summer(DATE) . " 

on social media , german(NORP) chancellor olaf(PERSON) scholz(PERSON) praised " couragious russians(NORP) " who turned out to pay their respects to navalny , while the eu(ORG) 's top diplomat , josep(PERSON) borrell(PERSON) , said that " navalny 's beliefs will not disappear . " 

more(DATE) than(DATE) a(DATE) quarter(DATE) of a million people watched the events on navalny 's youtube(ORG) channel(ORG) , which is blocked inside russia(GPE) . 

kremlin(ORG) threats 

a crowd of thousands(CARDINAL) marched from the church to the nearby borisovskoye cemetery after the funeral service . 

" we wo n't forget you ! " and " forgive us ! " some mourners shouted as the coffin arrived for burial . 

some(CARDINAL) 400(CARDINAL) mourners have been detained at navalny memorials since his death , rights organization ovd - info has said , but no arrests were reported on friday(DATE) despite warnings from the kremlin(ORG) . 

" any unauthorized gatherings will be in violation of the law and those who participate in them will be held responsible , " spokesman dmitry(PERSON) peskov(PERSON) was quoted as saying by russian(NORP) state media agency tass(ORG) . 

according to the rights monitoring group ovd - info , russian(NORP) police detained at(CARDINAL) least(CARDINAL) 67(CARDINAL) people in 16(CARDINAL) towns across the country at tributes to navalny . ovd - info said 18(CARDINAL) people were detained in the siberian(NORP) city of novosibirskto(GPE) and added that six(CARDINAL) people had been detained in moscow(GPE) . 

navalny 's family struggled for his burial 

russian(NORP) authorities handed over navalny 's body to his mother days(DATE) after his death following repeated demands . his mother refused to hold a burial in secret . 

navalny 's team has alleged that they had been looking for a place to bury his body , but russian(NORP) authorities created hurdles in the process . 

navalny 's team has alleged that he was murdered at the behest of putin(PERSON) as the critic was likely to be freed in a potential prisoner swap . 

while navalny 's allies have not provided any evidence to support their allegations , they have vowed to seek clarity about his death . 

meanwhile , the accusations have been dismissed by russia(GPE) and his death certificate states that navalny died of natural causes .

best - fish - fries - america : 

two(CARDINAL) of america(GPE) ’s best fish fries are in western new(GPE) york(GPE) 

the lent season is in full swing and many people will be heading out to grab a fish fry tonight(TIME) for lunch or dinner . 

did you know that western new(GPE) york(GPE) has some of the best fish fries in the entire country ? 

feel good mornings with dave(PERSON) fields(PERSON) 

mashed.com recently came out with their list of the " best fish fries in america(GPE) " and two(CARDINAL) restaurants from western(ORG) new(ORG) york(ORG) made the list .

the project contract covers the construction of a kitchen , toilets , store room and general repairs .

firefighters battling the largest wildfire in texas(GPE) history face increasingly difficult weather conditions on saturday(DATE) . 

the(ORG) smokehouse(ORG) creek(ORG) fire that began monday(DATE) has killed at(CARDINAL) least(CARDINAL) two(CARDINAL) people , left a charred landscape of scorched prairie , dead cattle and destroyed as(CARDINAL) many(CARDINAL) as(CARDINAL) 500(CARDINAL) structures , including burned - out homes , in the texas(GPE) panhandle . 

watch live : news 9(TIME) 6(TIME) p.m.(TIME) newscast 3/2/2024(CARDINAL) 

the national weather service in amarillo(GPE) has issued a red flag warning for the entire panhandle from late(TIME) saturday(TIME) morning(TIME) through(TIME) midnight(TIME) sunday(DATE) after rain and snow on thursday(DATE) allowed firefighters to contain a portion of the fire . 

" a combination of strong winds , low relative humidity and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread , " according to the weather service 's forecast . 

" critical fire weather conditions are expected to return ... as winds out of the southwest gust to 40(QUANTITY) to(QUANTITY) 45(QUANTITY) mph(QUANTITY) and humidity drops below(PERCENT) 10(PERCENT) percent(PERCENT) , " the forecast said , with a high temperature of 75(QUANTITY) degrees(QUANTITY) f(QUANTITY) ( 24(QUANTITY) degrees(QUANTITY) c ) . 

the fire , which has merged with another fire and crossed the state line into western(LOC) oklahoma(LOC) , has burned more(QUANTITY) than(QUANTITY) 1,700(QUANTITY) square(QUANTITY) miles(QUANTITY) ( 4,400(QUANTITY) square(QUANTITY) kilometers(QUANTITY) ) and was 15(PERCENT) %(PERCENT) contained , the(ORG) texas(ORG) a&m(ORG) forest(ORG) service(ORG) said friday(DATE) . 

the cause of the fire remains under investigation , although strong winds , dry grass and unseasonably warm weather fed the flames . 

" everybody needs to understand that we face enormous potential fire dangers as we head into this(DATE) weekend(DATE) , " republican(NORP) gov . greg(PERSON) abbott(PERSON) said friday(DATE) after touring the area . " no one can let down their guard . everyone must remain very vigilant . " 

two(CARDINAL) women were confirmed killed by the fires this(DATE) week(DATE) . but with flames still menacing a wide area , authorities have n't yet thoroughly searched for victims or tallied homes and other structures damaged or destroyed . 

two(CARDINAL) firefighters were injured battling the flames in oklahoma(GPE) . one(CARDINAL) suffered a heat - related injury and the other was injured when the brush pumper he was riding in struck a tanker truck as the two(CARDINAL) were heading to fight the fire near gage . 

both firefighters are expected to recover . 

texas(ORG) agriculture(ORG) commissioner sid(PERSON) miller(PERSON) said individual ranchers could suffer devastating losses due to the fires , but predicted the overall impact on the texas(GPE) cattle industry and consumer beef prices would be minimal . the fires are leaving " dead animals everywhere , " texas rep . ronny(PERSON) jackson(PERSON) said in a video update on wednesday(DATE) .

fishermen - possible - spy - balloon - fbi - alaska : 

commercial fishermen off the coast of alaska(GPE) have found what officials are concerned could be another spy balloon and are bringing it to shore with them , three(CARDINAL) sources familiar with the matter told cnn(ORG) . 

fbi(ORG) agents will meet the fishing vessel when it comes into port , which is expected to be sometime over the(DATE) weekend(DATE) . the bureau will then transport the unknown object to the fbi(ORG) lab in quantico(GPE) , virginia(GPE) , to be analyzed , as has been done with previous surveillance balloons . 

the fishmen shared photographs of the object with law enforcement upon encountering it , the sources said . all three(CARDINAL) sources emphasized that it was n’t clear exactly what the object was and that it may not be a balloon at all — but that the fbi(ORG) determined that it was similar enough in appearance to a foreign - government owned surveillance balloon that it warranted further investigation . 

the fbi(ORG) said in a statement friday(DATE) night(TIME) it is “ aware of debris found off the coast of alaska(GPE) by a commercial fishing vessel . we will work with our partners to assist with the logistics of the debris recovery . ” 

cnn(ORG) was unable to identify the fishing vessel . 

the existence of high - altitude surveillance balloons burst into us consciousness last(DATE) year(DATE) , when a chinese(NORP) spy balloon appeared to blow off course and transited across the continental us . that balloon entered us territory through alaskan(NORP) airspace . 

the us(GPE) assessed that the spy balloon was part of an extensive surveillance program run by the chinese(NORP) military , as cnn(ORG) reported at the time . the balloon fleet , according to us officials , had conducted at(CARDINAL) least(CARDINAL) two(CARDINAL) dozen(CARDINAL) missions over at(CARDINAL) least(CARDINAL) five(CARDINAL) continents in recent(DATE) years(DATE) . 

china(GPE) appeared to suspend the program following the episode , and it ’s not clear whether it has been restarted . taiwan(GPE) in january(DATE) accused beijing(GPE) of flying multiple balloons through its airspace . 

the biden administration ultimately shot down the balloon that flew over the us(GPE) last(DATE) february(DATE) . following the incident , the us(GPE) widened the aperture of its radar systems so that it could better detect objects traveling above a certain altitude and at certain speeds . the aim was to fix a “ domain awareness gap ” that had allowed three(CARDINAL) other suspected chinese(NORP) spy balloons to transit the(ORG) continental(ORG) united(ORG) states(ORG) undetected under the trump administration , gen(ORG) . glen(PERSON) vanherck(PERSON) , commander of us northern command and north(ORG) american(ORG) aerospace(ORG) defense(ORG) command(ORG) , said at the time . 

the more sensitive radar systems have allowed the us(GPE) military to spot more unidentified objects in us airspace . there were three(CARDINAL) additional shootdowns of unidentified high - altitude objects in the(DATE) weeks(DATE) following the chinese(NORP) balloon incident . just(DATE) last(DATE) week(DATE) , the north(NORP) american(NORP) aerospace defense command sent fighter jets to intercept and examine a small balloon over the southwest , drifting east . norad(PERSON) later said in a statement that the balloon was “ likely a hobby balloon ” that posed no threat . 

the pentagon(ORG) had said that the chinese(NORP) surveillance balloon did not collect intelligence while flying over the country , but us intelligence agencies did find that it used an american(NORP) internet service provider to send short , periodic transmissions of data related to navigation and location back to china(GPE) , according to a us official . 

the network connection was not used to transmit intelligence back to china(GPE) , according to the official . the balloon stored that information for later , including imagery and other data , which the us(GPE) has since been able to study . 

this story has bene updated with additional reporting . 

cnn(ORG) ’s hannah(PERSON) rabinowitz(PERSON) contributed to this report .

labour - criticises - lee - andersons - appearance - at - tory - fundraiser - with - liz - truss : 

labour said it “ beggars belief ” that lee(PERSON) anderson(PERSON) reportedly attended a conservative fundraiser with former prime minister liz(PERSON) truss(PERSON) , despite currently being suspended as a tory mp . 

a report in the daily(DATE) express suggested mr anderson(PERSON) was at a dinner to raise money for bassetlaw mp brendan(PERSON) clarke(PERSON) -(PERSON) smith(PERSON) on friday(DATE) . 

the former tory(NORP) deputy chairman is said to have been given a standing ovation by those in attendance , with ms truss , according to an anonymous onlooker cited by the newspaper , saying , “ who is this de - whipped tory ? ” as she greeted him . 

the express published a photo which it says shows mr anderson(PERSON) , ms truss and mr clarke(PERSON) -(PERSON) smith(PERSON) posing together at the fundraiser . 

labour has urged prime minister rishi(PERSON) sunak(PERSON) to ban mr anderson(PERSON) from raising funds for the tories while he is without the party whip . 

mr anderson(PERSON) , an outspoken mp in the ‘ red wall ’ — labour ’s traditional heartlands across the midlands and north of england where the tories made gains during the 2019(DATE) election — has refused to apologise for the remarks despite mr sunak labelling them “ wrong ” . 

the former labour councillor has also refused to rule out potentially standing for reform uk , the former brexit party , at the next election .
